Body.Description: Create new virtual machine on the selected Hypervisor based on specifications in a virtual machine or template file. The inputs cluster (or host), datastore, and template name or virtual machine are mandatory. If folder name is specified, then virtual machine will be placed within the folder. On successful execution, name of virtual machine and template name or virtual machine are generated as outputs.
Body.Label: New Virtual Machine from Template or Clone from Virtual Machine
Body.Name: NewVirtualMachineFromTemplate

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter where the virtual machine will be provisioned.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster where the virtual machine will be provisioned.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the virtual machine will be provisioned. Either a cluster or a host must be specified.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Folder (optional) in which the virtual machine will be provisioned.
InputDefinition.Label: Folder
InputDefinition.Name: Folder

InputDefinition.Description: Resource pool for the new virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Resource Pool
InputDefinition.Name: ResourcePool

InputDefinition.Description: Datastore allocated for this virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

InputDefinition.Description:
Path of the template or virtual machine used to provision the virtual machine, template or virtual machine should be available locally in the hypervisor manager. When template or virtual machine is directly under a Datacenter  the template path or virtual machine path should be /<<DATACENTER>>/vm/<<TEMPLATE-NAME-or-VM-NAME>>

When template or virtual machine is in a Datacenter and a Folder,  the template or virtual machine path should be /<<DATACENTER>>/vm/<<FOLDER>>/<<TEMPLATE-NAME-or-VM-Name>>
For example: Template 'Template1' in Datacenter 'DC1' should be /DC1/vm/Template1
Template 'Template1' in Datacenter 'DC1' under a Folder 'Folder1', should be /DC1/vm/Folder1/Template1.
InputDefinition.Label: Template or Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: Template

InputDefinition.Description: Name of the virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: Name

InputDefinition.Description: Number of CPUs (optional) to allocate for the new virtual machine, if not provided will be taken from the template or virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: CPUs
InputDefinition.Name: CPUs

InputDefinition.Description: Memory (optional) allocation for the new virtual machine, in multiples of 4MB, if not provided will be taken from the template or virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Memory
InputDefinition.Name: Memory

InputDefinition.Description: Annotation (optional) for the virtual machine, if not given, the virtual machine will have <no value> as annotation.
InputDefinition.Label: Annotation
InputDefinition.Name: Annotation

InputDefinition.Description: If checked, virtual machine will be powered up after creation.
InputDefinition.Label: Power On
InputDefinition.Name: PowerOn

InputDefinition.Description: Network to be mapped to the Virtual Machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Network
InputDefinition.Name: Network

InputDefinition.Description: OVA environment customization spec as JSON.
InputDefinition.Label: OVA Environment Spec
InputDefinition.Name: OVAEnvSpec

InputDefinition.Description: Configuration parameters specified as JSON.
InputDefinition.Label: Configuration Parameters
InputDefinition.Name: ExtraConfig

OutputDefinition.Label: Name of the Template or Virtual Machine
OutputDefinition.Name: Template

OutputDefinition.Description: Folder Name for the new virtual machine.
OutputDefinition.Label: Folder
OutputDefinition.Name: Folder

Body.Description: Search for a network  in Infoblox and return the unique network object reference
Body.Label: Infoblox - Get network reference from subnet
Body.Name: Infoblox-Getnetworkreferencefromsubnet

InputDefinition.Description: The API call can be made to Intersight or an external endpoint added as Target. Target should be in claimed or connected state. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked. An empty value for this input indicates that the API call is made to Intersight.
InputDefinition.Label: External Target
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Properties.Selector: /api/v1/asset/Targets?$filter=((TargetType eq HTTPEndpoint and Status eq Claimed) or ((TargetType eq PureStorageFlashArray or TargetType eq HitachiVirtualStoragePlatform or TargetType eq NetAppActiveIqUnifiedManager or TargetType eq TerraformCloud or TargetType eq VmwareVcenter or TargetType eq APIC or TargetType eq MDSDevice or TargetType eq NexusDevice) and Status eq Connected))

OutputDefinition.Name: networkView

OutputDefinition.Description: The network found

OutputDefinition.Description: The unique Reference Object for the given network. This reference is used to identify the network.

Body.Description: Unclaims the target endpoint from Intersight. When a target is unclaimed, it is immediately detached from the corresponding Intersight account. The target retains any configuration applied before the unclaim operation. You can unclaim any type of target endpoints.
Body.Label: Remove Target
Body.Name: RemoveTarget

InputDefinition.Description: Target to be unclaimed. Supported targets are HTTP EndPoint, SSH EndPoint, Ansible and Powershell EndPoint
InputDefinition.Label: Target
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Body.Description:
A DNS name, IPv4 or IPv6 address.

This type accepts the following values:
- Host name, e.g. 'my-host123'.
- Fully-qualified host name, e.g. my-host123.example.com.
- The host name and domain can contain letters, digits and hyphen.
- The host name and sub-domains must start with a letter or digit. The top-level domain must start with a letter.
- The top-level domain must start with a letter.
- IPv4 address, e.g. 192.168.1.4.
- IPv6 address, e.g. fe80::20c:29ff:fe3c:55f1.
Body.Label: Internet Address Type
Body.Name: InternetAddressType

TypeDefinition.Description:
A DNS name, IPv4 or IPv6 address.

This type accepts the following values:
- Host name, e.g. 'my-host123'.
- Fully-qualified host name, e.g. my-host123.example.com.
- The host name and domain can contain letters, digits and hyphen.
- The host name and sub-domains must start with a letter or digit. The top-level domain must start with a letter.
- The top-level domain must start with a letter.
- IPv4 address, e.g. 192.168.1.4.
- IPv6 address, e.g. fe80::20c:29ff:fe3c:55f1.
TypeDefinition.Label: Internet Address
TypeDefinition.Name: InternetAddress

TypeDefinition.Label: Target Type

TypeDefinition.Label: Connect through an Intersight Assist
TypeDefinition.Name: ConnectViaAssist

TypeDefinition.Label: Intersight Assist
TypeDefinition.Name: Assist

TypeDefinition.Description: Disable if the endpoint doesn't require any authentication or when the authentication required for the endpoint is not supported in the Authentication Scheme dropdown, in which case respective authentication parameters should be provided in the Web API task inputs.
TypeDefinition.Label: Authentication Required

TypeDefinition.Description: Indicates whether a connection to the target should be established using HTTPS.
TypeDefinition.Label: Enable HTTPS Protocol
TypeDefinition.Name: EnableHTTPSProtocol

Body.Description: Claims a new target endpoint in Intersight. The supported target types are HTTP , SSH, Powershell and Ansible endpoint.
Body.Label: New Target
Body.Name: NewTarget

InputDefinition.Description: A user provided name for the managed target
InputDefinition.Label: Name
InputDefinition.Name: Name

InputDefinition.Description: The DNS hostname or IP Address, either IPv4 or IPv6, to be used to connect to the managed target
InputDefinition.Label: Hostname or IP Address
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: The port number to be used to connect to the managed target.Valid values are 1 - 65535. If not provided, a default port used to establish the connection to the given target. For HTTP connection, default port used is 443. For SSH/Ansible connection, default port used is 22. For Powershell connection, default port used is 5986.
InputDefinition.Label: Port
InputDefinition.Name: Port

InputDefinition.Description: Options to claim a new target. Supported targets are HTTP EndPoint, SSH EndPoint, Ansible and Powershell EndPoint
InputDefinition.Label: Claim Target Options
InputDefinition.Name: ClaimTargetOptions

OutputDefinition.Description: Moid of the managed target
OutputDefinition.Label: Target
OutputDefinition.Name: Target

Body.Description: SSH command to execute on the remote server. SSH task executor supports executing non-interactive and prompts based interactive commands.
Body.Label: SSH Command Type
Body.Name: SshCommandType

TypeDefinition.Description: The SSH commands that are to be run on the remote server. Multiple commands can be configured to be run on the given target by chaining the commands with special characters - '&&'  ';' '|' etc. Note that command chaining is allowed only when the command type is Non-Interactive.
TypeDefinition.Label: Command
TypeDefinition.Name: Command

TypeDefinition.Description: The SSH command type to be run on the remote server. The SSH task supports running Non-Interactive and expect prompts based Interactive commands.
TypeDefinition.Label: Command Type
TypeDefinition.Name: CommandType

TypeDefinition.Description: Expect prompts required as part of command execution. It is a collection of ExpectPrompt type.
TypeDefinition.Label: Expect Prompts
TypeDefinition.Name: ExpectPrompts

TypeDefinition.Description: The regular expression of the Shell Prompt of the remote server or target. You must provide the complete regular expression of the Shell Prompt and it must end with special character '$' to match the end of the Shell Prompt string.
TypeDefinition.Label: Shell Prompt
TypeDefinition.Name: ShellPrompt

Body.Description:
Response parser framework supports extraction of required values from API/device responses. These responses may be of various content types such as XML, JSON, etc. The values of importance are modeled as parameters in the response parser framework.
The parameters can be of a scalar value type or a collection of values. A group of related parameters can be modeled as a single complex type parameter. These complex types will be very useful to extract a set of repeating group of related parameters.
A response parser specification defines the set of parameters that need to be extracted from the content. The response parser specification allows complex type definitions to be defined for any complex parameters.
Body.Label: Response Parser
Body.Name: TextResponseParserType

TypeDefinition.Description: The collection of parameters that need to be extracted from the API response.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parameters
TypeDefinition.Name: Parameters

Body.Description: Executes SSH commands against the given endpoint. This task can be executed on targets added as SSH Endpoint or Ansible Endpoint in Intersight.
Body.Label: Invoke SSH Commands
Body.Name: InvokeSshCommands

InputDefinition.Description: The external target on which the SSH commands are run. The SSH commands can be run only on targets added as SSH Endpoint or Ansible Endpoint target in Intersight and are in the connected state.
InputDefinition.Label: External Target
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Properties.Selector: /api/v1/asset/Targets?$filter=((TargetType eq SSHEndpoint or TargetType eq AnsibleEndpoint) and Status eq Connected)

InputDefinition.Description: The SSH commands that are run on the remote server along with the details of the SSH command.
InputDefinition.Label: SSH Command
InputDefinition.Name: SshCommand

InputDefinition.Description: The command timeout in seconds for the execution of the command against the given endpoint. The default command timeout is 600 seconds. Range is from 10 to 7200 seconds.
InputDefinition.Label: Command Timeout
InputDefinition.Name: Timeout

InputDefinition.Description: The list of expected command exit codes of the execution of the command against the given endpoint. Default exit code of 0 is used to determine the status of command execution when this input is not provided.
InputDefinition.Label: Expected Exit Codes
InputDefinition.Name: ExpectedExitCodes

InputDefinition.Description: Set this value to True if the entire command response needs to be displayed as part of the task output. Default value is false.
InputDefinition.Label: Show Command Output
InputDefinition.Name: ShowCommandOutput

InputDefinition.Description: The structure of the response parser which provides the list of values that need to be extracted from the response.
InputDefinition.Label: Response Parser
InputDefinition.Name: ResponseParser

OutputDefinition.Description: The exit code after the execution of the command against the given endpoint.
OutputDefinition.Label: Exit Code
OutputDefinition.Name: ExitCode

OutputDefinition.Description: The complete response after the execution of the command against the given endpoint.
OutputDefinition.Label: Command Output
OutputDefinition.Name: CommandOutput

OutputDefinition.Description: Captures the error encountered while executing the command.
OutputDefinition.Label: Command Execution Error
OutputDefinition.Name: CommandExecutionError

OutputDefinition.Description: The extracted parameters after the execution of the command against the given endpoint.
OutputDefinition.Label: Extracted Parameters
OutputDefinition.Name: ExtractedParameters

InputDefinition.Description: The subnet in which the IPv4 address is returned
InputDefinition.Label: Subnet in CIDR notification
InputDefinition.Name: subnet

InputDefinition.Description: The hostname
InputDefinition.Label: Hostname
InputDefinition.Name: hostName

Tasks.Description: Create new virtual machine on the selected Hypervisor based on specifications in a virtual machine or template file. The inputs cluster (or host), datastore, and template name or virtual machine are mandatory. If folder name is specified, then virtual machine will be placed within the folder. On successful execution, name of virtual machine and template name or virtual machine are generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: New Virtual Machine from Template or Clone from Virtual Machine
Tasks.Name: NewVirtualMachineFromTemplate1

Tasks.Description: Add a new virtual network interface card to a virtual machine. Requires datacenter, virtual machine, network, adapter type and mac address type as inputs. On successful execution, virtual machine, network, adapter type, mac address and virtual NIC are generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: Add Network to Virtual Machine
Tasks.Name: AddVirtualNICToVirtualMachine1

Tasks.Description: Search for a network  in Infoblox and return the unique network object reference
Tasks.Label: Infoblox - Get network reference from subnet
Tasks.Name: InfobloxGetnetworkreferencefromsubnet1

Tasks.Description: Get next available IPv4 address from a subnet using the next_available_ip function provided by Infoblox
Tasks.Label: Infoblox - Get next available IPv4 address
Tasks.Name: InfobloxGetnextavailableIPv4address1

Tasks.Description: Reserve the passed IPv4 in a given network, and associate to a given MAC address
Tasks.Label: Infoblox - Reserve IPv4 Address
Tasks.Name: InfobloxReserveIPv4Address1

Tasks.Description: Guest Customization for a virtual machine. The virtual machine will be restarted to apply the customization. The inputs datacenter, virtual machine name, Hostname and timezone are mandatory. On successful execution, the customized properties of virtual machine will be generated as outputs.
Tasks.Label: Invoke Guest Customization for Linux Virtual Machine
Tasks.Name: InvokeGuestCustomizationForLinuxVirtualMachine1

Tasks.Description: Pauses the current workflow for the specified duration.
Tasks.Label: Wait 1 Minute for Customization
Tasks.Name: InvokeSleepTask1

Tasks.Description: Claims a new target endpoint in Intersight. The supported target types are HTTP , SSH, Powershell and Ansible endpoint.
Tasks.Label: Create Target for VM
Tasks.Name: NewTarget1

Tasks.Description: Executes SSH commands against the given endpoint. This task can be executed on targets added as SSH Endpoint or Ansible Endpoint in Intersight.
Tasks.Label: Install Opencart Database Application
Tasks.Name: InvokeSshCommands1

Tasks.Description: Unclaims the target endpoint from Intersight. When a target is unclaimed, it is immediately detached from the corresponding Intersight account. The target retains any configuration applied before the unclaim operation. You can unclaim any type of target endpoints.
Tasks.Label: Remove Target
Tasks.Name: RemoveTarget1

Body.Description: New Vmware virtual machine from template or Clone from Virtual Machine
Body.Label: New Vmware Virtual Machine from Template or Clone from Virtual Machine
Body.Name: NewVMFromTemplateImpl

InputDefinition.Description: Datacenter where the virtual machine will be provisioned.
InputDefinition.Label: Datacenter
InputDefinition.Name: Datacenter

InputDefinition.Description: Cluster where the virtual machine will be provisioned.
InputDefinition.Label: Cluster
InputDefinition.Name: Cluster

InputDefinition.Description: Host on which the virtual machine will be provisioned. Either a cluster or a host must be specified.
InputDefinition.Label: Host
InputDefinition.Name: Host

InputDefinition.Description: Folder (optional) in which the virtual machine will be provisioned.
InputDefinition.Label: Folder
InputDefinition.Name: Folder

InputDefinition.Description: Resource pool for the new virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Resource Pool
InputDefinition.Name: ResourcePool

InputDefinition.Description: Datastore allocated for this virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Datastore
InputDefinition.Name: Datastore

InputDefinition.Description:
Path of the template or virtual machine used to provision the virtual machine, template or virtual machine should be available locally in the hypervisor manager. When template or virtual machine is directly under a Datacenter  the template path or virtual machine path should be /<<DATACENTER>>/vm/<<TEMPLATE-NAME-or-VM-NAME>>

When template or virtual machine is in a Datacenter and a Folder,  the template or virtual machine path should be /<<DATACENTER>>/vm/<<FOLDER>>/<<TEMPLATE-NAME-or-VM-Name>>
For example: Template 'Template1' in Datacenter 'DC1' should be /DC1/vm/Template1
Template 'Template1' in Datacenter 'DC1' under a Folder 'Folder1', should be /DC1/vm/Folder1/Template1.
InputDefinition.Label: Template or Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: Template

InputDefinition.Description: Name of the virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Virtual Machine
InputDefinition.Name: Name

InputDefinition.Description: Number of CPUs (optional) to allocate for the new virtual machine, if not provided will be taken from the template or virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: CPUs
InputDefinition.Name: CPUs

InputDefinition.Description: Memory (optional) allocation for the new virtual machine, in multiples of 4MB, if not provided will be taken from the template or virtual machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Memory
InputDefinition.Name: Memory

InputDefinition.Description: Annotation (optional) for the virtual machine, if not given, the virtual machine will have <no value> as annotation.
InputDefinition.Label: Annotation
InputDefinition.Name: Annotation

InputDefinition.Description: If checked, virtual machine will be powered up after creation.
InputDefinition.Label: Power On
InputDefinition.Name: PowerOn

InputDefinition.Description: Network to be mapped to the Virtual Machine.
InputDefinition.Label: Network
InputDefinition.Name: Network

InputDefinition.Description: OVA environment customization spec as JSON.
InputDefinition.Label: OVA Environment Spec
InputDefinition.Name: OVAEnvSpec

InputDefinition.Description: Configuration parameters specified as JSON.
InputDefinition.Label: Configuration Parameters
InputDefinition.Name: ExtraConfig

OutputDefinition.Label: Name of the Template or Virtual Machine
OutputDefinition.Name: Template

OutputDefinition.Description: Folder Name for the new virtual machine.
OutputDefinition.Label: Folder
OutputDefinition.Name: Folder

Batch.Body: { "Datacenter":"{{.global.task.input.Datacenter}}",  {{if .global.task.input.Folder}}"Folder":"{{.global.task.input.Folder}}",{{ else }}"Folder": "",{{end}}      "VmName":"{{.global.task.input.VmName}}",  {{if .global.task.input.Name}}"Name":"{{.global.task.input.Name}}",{{ else }}"Name": "",{{end}}  "TimeZone":"{{.global.task.input.TimeZone}}", {{if .global.task.input.Domain}}"Domain":"{{.global.task.input.Domain}}",{{ else }}"Domain": "",{{end}}  "NetworkInterfaces1":{{.global.task.input.NetworkInterfaces1 | ToJson}}, "DnsServers":{{.global.task.input.DnsServers | ToJson}}, "DnsSuffixes":{{.global.task.input.DnsSuffixes | ToJson}}  }
Batch.Name: NewGuestCustomizationforLinuxImpl

Outcomes.Message: {{.global.NewGuestCustomizationforLinuxImpl.output.HttpStatusMsg}}
Customization successfully triggered for the virtual machine '{{.global.NewGuestCustomizationforLinuxImpl.output.vmConfig.VM}}'.

Body.Description: Guest Customization for virtual machine
Body.Name: NewGuestCustomizationforLinuxImpl
